title: Add global SmartSize option for RDP/VNC
author: C4rb0n
body_snippet:
<!--
Only file GitHub issues for bugs and feature requests.  All other topics will be closed.

Before opening an issue, please search for a duplicate or closed issue.
Please provide as much detail as possible for us to fix your issue.
-->

<!-- Feature Request -->
<!-- If you file a feature request, please delete the bug section -->
Please add a global option to enable SmartSize for RDP/VNC by default.

I often log into the computer on which I have mRemoteNG running, from a remote com...

iterations.description: Clear feature request with community support (+1) to add a global SmartSize default option for RDP/VNC connections, reducing repetitive per-connection configuration

comments.author: sparerd
comments.snippet:
I would like to have default connection options for every supported protocol, which would fit your needs (if i'm understanding you correctly).

Currently, we can only set protocol options for the default protocol.

comments.author: C4rb0n
comments.snippet:
Actually my requested enhancement is not necessary.  I hadn't realized that the SmartSize option was already available under the "Appearance" option for the connection definition.  That is good enough, so this can be closed.

Thank you for your efforts in improving the software.

comments.author: sparerd
comments.snippet: Glad to hear you found a way to make it work! Closing the issue

comments.author: slorandus
comments.snippet:
Actualy it would be usefull to have Smartsize as a standalone option, apart from the resolutions selectlist.

For example, I would like to connect by RDP to a server using a resolution higher than my laptop resolution (to have more space) and I need to set Smartsize on the tab options, everytime. I just want to set Smartsize as default for that connection.

Shortly, for a connection I want to select resolution 1600x900 combined with Smartsize. Is this possible?

Thanks.

comments.author: geobam
comments.snippet:
I second that. I would also love this as an extra option, since I heavily use this option on a daily basis.

Because:
When set to _Smart Size_ under _Appearence_ it doesn't do the same as:
When set a fixed resolution (e.g. 1920x1080) and **after** connection established, make a right click and set _Smart Size_.

comments.author: brensly
comments.snippet:
+1 for this. 

There is a big need for me personally to be able to:
1. Set a fixed resolution for one or many objects (example 1920x1080)
2. At the same time activate Smart Size so that it scales to fit my panel

Configuring Smart Size for the objects it appears does the same thing as "Fit to panel", i.e. setting a custom resolution that fits my panel without scaling.

The workaround as of now is to:
1. Set a fixed resolution in the object configuration (example 1920x1080)
2. Connect
...

comments.author: plpagadorfdez
comments.snippet:
+1 for this too.

Are there any plans on including this separated config option under Appearance? For me, it would be very helpful since I need to open several RDP connections daily with a fixed resolution and I always need to rightclick->smartsize for each connection like @brensly suggested in the workaround.

comments.author: Kvarkas
comments.snippet: hi, yes planning to add profiles next release that allow more granular control of almost everything

notes:
AI triage: Clear feature request with community support (+1) to add a global SmartSize default option for RDP/VNC connections, reducing repetitive per-connection configuration
Approach: Add SmartSize to DefaultConnectionInfo so new connections inherit the global default, and expose the option in the Options/Connections UI page
